dialogue: What's up man?
I'm pretty good, I found a bunch of these hotdogs in Jerry's car so we'll be eating good tonight.
choice1: Speaking of that, what's up with Jerry's car?

dialogue: I dunno. He says it's pretty messed up so it might be a while.
choice1: So how on earth are we supposed to survive out here?

dialogue: Love to hear it.
After these hotdogs I don't think we have any food. Jerry brought his cooler so atleast we wont dehydrate.
choice1: What are we doing about food then?!
choice2: I'm exhausted. I want some hot dogs already.

dialogue: This place has a pool of all sorts of birds and berries, I know you know your way with hunting so that will probably be your responsiblity.
Remember, don't shoot a dove, it's bad luck.
[He smiles but says nothing]
How's the hunt?
That's great! I'll get everything ready.
It's okay, just keep trying and you'll succeed.
Yup.
I don't see anything...
What do you mean bad? You did a great job hunting!
How is the hunt my friend?
That is wonderful to hear, my friend. But, please, do not fret if the meat is...
Raw.
choice1: Raw?! We have a blazing fire it won't be hard to cook it!

dialogue: Do not raise your voice at me, boy. I am a highly superior being in comparison to the likes of you. I am a king and you are my servant.
choice2: Stop running your mouth and cook the food.

dialogue: No promises, friend.
You think I am acting strange, do you? You're a victim to your own mental decline.
I do not accept failures, go hunt a bird before I cook you for dinner.
Do not lie to me, boy.
You best apologize.
I know everything and will always know everything.
[He stares through you, barely acknowledging your even there]
Speak only when I say you can.
Tell me, do you have an offering? Speak!
choice2: Tommy what are you talking about?

dialogue: I require an offering to satisfy my hunger.
Do not call me by my "human name". Your species is no better than pigs rolling in mud.
Yes... food.
choice1: I will get some, you could've just asked.

dialogue: Hurry or you will find "Jerry" slumped in your tent.
Very good.
You dare lie to me? You're death will be untimely.
Why did you just speak?
Yes, your species.
choice1: Has this forest made you lose your mind!?

dialogue: My mind is where it's always been. Pay yourself more attention, plebian.
Your species is so stubborn about its own survival that despite its extreme weakness, its lasted longer than predicted. But you and "Jerry" will not.
You're death will be untimely.
[within his bloodshot eyes, he looks trapped and confused]
Man! Our car broke down and it's a hot mess! I hope I can get it repaired soon...
choice1: Just keep trying I know you can do it.

dialogue: It's so hot out, and this old beauty has a worn down clutch. Combine the two and you get this mess.
choice1: You're pretty handy though, I trust you to get it done.

dialogue: I appreciate it, I might need your help some time so if you hear me holler, it will only take a minute, promise.
Thanks!
